body: please use stable5 branch in windows server environment.  thx
i am - the problem occurs even with the newest stable5 branch...

hi,

maybe the label "windows server" is not correct.
i have the same issue with my server under ubuntu 12.04.
the only way to stop that hell fall is to restart the web server or the db server.

here is my infinite repetition of query :

                  100 query     select * from `oc_users` where lower(`uid`) = lower('group-board')
                  100 query     select count(*) from `oc_users` where lower(`uid`) = lower('group-board') limit 3
                  100 query     select `id` from `oc_mimetypes` where `mimetype` = 'httpd/unix-directory'
                  100 query     select `fileid`, `name`, `mimetype` from `oc_filecache` where `parent` in ('12')
                  100 query     select `fileid`, `name`, `mimetype` from `oc_filecache` where `parent` in ('15')
                  100 query     select `uid` from `oc_group_user` where `gid` = 'group-board' and `uid` like '%'
                  100 query     select `configvalue` from `oc_preferences` where `userid` = 'user2' and `appid` = 'files_sharing' and `configkey` = 'etag'
                  100 query     update `oc_preferences` set `configvalue` = '514849be3ae3b' where `userid` = 'user2' and `appid` = 'files_sharing' and `configkey` = 'etag'
                  100 query     select `configvalue` from `oc_appconfig` where `appid` = 'core' and `configkey` = 'shareapi_enabled'
                  100 query     select `oc_share`.`id`, `item_type`, `oc_share`.`parent`, `share_type`, `share_with`, `file_source`, `path`, `permissions`, `stime`, `expiration`, `token`, `storage` from `oc_share` inner join `oc_filecache` on `file_source` = `oc_filecache`.`fileid` and `uid_owner` = 'user2' and `share_type` != '2' and ( `file_source` = '15' or `item_type` in ('folder'))
                  100 query     select `configvalue` from `oc_preferences` where `userid` = 'user3' and `appid` = 'files_sharing' and `configkey` = 'etag'
                  100 query     update `oc_preferences` set `configvalue` = '514849be46df3' where `userid` = 'user3' and `appid` = 'files_sharing' and `configkey` = 'etag'
                  100 query     select `configvalue` from `oc_appconfig` where `appid` = 'core' and `configkey` = 'shareapi_enabled'
                  100 query     select `oc_share`.`id`, `item_type`, `oc_share`.`parent`, `share_type`, `share_with`, `file_source`, `path`, `permissions`, `stime`, `expiration`, `token`, `storage` from `oc_share` inner join `oc_filecache` on `file_source` = `oc_filecache`.`fileid` and `uid_owner` = 'user3' and `share_type` != '2' and ( `file_source` = '15' or `item_type` in ('folder'))
                  100 query     select `configvalue` from `oc_preferences` where `userid` = 'user1' and `appid` = 'files_sharing' and `configkey` = 'etag'
                  100 query     update `oc_preferences` set `configvalue` = '514849be61594' where `userid` = 'user1' and `appid` = 'files_sharing' and `configkey` = 'etag'
                  100 query     select `configvalue` from `oc_appconfig` where `appid` = 'core' and `configkey` = 'shareapi_enabled'
                  100 query     select `oc_share`.`id`, `item_type`, `oc_share`.`parent`, `share_type`, `share_with`, `file_source`, `path`, `permissions`, `stime`, `expiration`, `token`, `storage` from `oc_share` inner join `oc_filecache` on `file_source` = `oc_filecache`.`fileid` and `uid_owner` = 'user1' and `share_type` != '2' and ( `file_source` = '15' or `item_type` in ('folder'))
                  100 query     select `id` from `oc_storages` where `numeric_id` = '2'

> {"app":"core","message":"setting locale to en_us.utf-8 failed. support is probably not installed on your system","level":3,"time":1363596935} {"app":"core","message":"setting locale to en_us.utf-8 failed. support is probably not installed on your system","level":3,"time":1363596935}

there is something really broken on your server - this message is a pre oc5 message.
please make sure your installation is proper setup.

> {"app":"php","message":"file_put_contents(upload\/owncloud-5144918f59a3f\/_owncloud_ap .....

this actually shows that the installation cannot proper detect your temp folder.
can you please double check your php settings if possible? thx
@jcdevaux i think your issue is a different one - please open a new issue - thx

hi @deepdiver1975 !

i changed the upload path to 
```
upload_tmp_dir = "c:/program files (x86)/php/upload"
```
which seems to fix the lines in phplog like

```
{"app":"php","message":"file_put_contents(upload\/owncloud-5144918f59a3f\/_owncloud_ap
```

afterwards i dropped owncloud's mysql schema, recreated it, set installed=false and set owncloud up again with the current core/apps/3rdparty-stable5-branch.
after set up: owncloud-log:
```
{"app":"php","message":"mysql_close(): 47 is not a valid mysql-link resource at c:\\inetpuba\\wwwroot\\owncloud\\lib\\setup.php#273","level":2,"time":1363704503}
```
after uploading (better: on uploading) cpu of apache and mysql raises to ~17%, doing the same as mentioned above. ages later php-log:
```
[19-mar-2013 14:40:30 utc] php fatal error:  allowed memory size of 536870912 bytes exhausted (tried to allocate 65488 bytes) in c:\inetpuba\wwwroot\owncloud\lib\db.php on line 700
```
btw: 536870912 bytes = 512 mib!!! 

the file is created successfully, but it never stops showing the uploading behaviour.

i believe i just ran into this issue also...fresh 5.0 install on win2k8. had to restart mysql for it to stop..

i have a folder with ~2gb of file and many sub-folders shared with a group.

clicking on one of the nested sub-folders to share it causes this to happen every time.

i can provide more info/logs/etc. just let me know what to do.. removing the group share from the top folder prevents the endless db queries.
@mtgap @icewind1991 @blizzz you guys know more on this i asume - thx
i believe this is a duplicate of #2559 and already fixed with #2474
if you have merged #2474 already to core-stable5, then: no, it's not fixed.
